member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Forms.BrowserFileExtensions

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Forms.BrowserFileExtensions.RequestImageFileAsync(Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Forms.IBrowserFile,System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Attempts to convert the current image file to a new one of the specified file type and maximum file dimensions.
Caution: there is no guarantee that the file will be converted, or will even be a valid image file at all, either before or after conversion. The conversion is requested within the browser before it is transferred to .NET code, so the resulting data should be treated as untrusted.
member.remarks: The image will be scaled to fit the specified dimensions while preserving the original aspect ratio.
member.param: The to convert to a new image file.
member.returns: A representing the completion of the operation.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Forms.IBrowserFile
member.summary:
Represents the data of a file selected from an component.
Note: Metadata is provided by the client and is untrusted.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Forms.IBrowserFile.Name
member.summary: Gets the name of the file as specified by the browser.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Forms.IBrowserFile.LastModified
member.summary: Gets the last modified date as specified by the browser.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Forms.IBrowserFile.Size
member.summary: Gets the size of the file in bytes as specified by the browser.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Forms.IBrowserFile.ContentType
member.summary: Gets the MIME type of the file as specified by the browser.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Forms.IBrowserFile.OpenReadStream(System.Int64,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Opens the stream for reading the uploaded file.
member.param:
The maximum number of bytes that can be supplied by the Stream. Defaults to 500 KB.
Calling will throw if the file's size, as specified by is larger than . By default, if the user supplies a file larger than 500 KB, this method will throw an exception.
It is valuable to choose a size limit that corresponds to your use case. If you allow excessively large files, this may result in excessive consumption of memory or disk/database space, depending on what your code does with the supplied .
For Blazor Server in particular, beware of reading the entire stream into a memory buffer unless you have passed a suitably low size limit, since you will be consuming that memory on the server.
A cancellation token to signal the cancellation of streaming file data.
member.exception: Thrown if the file's length exceeds the value.

member.summary: Gets the file entries list. This method should be used for inputs that accept multiple files. If the input accepts only a single file, then use the property instead.
member.param: The maximum number of files to accept. If the number of files exceeds this value, this method will throw an exception.

member.summary: Repesents configurable options for .

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Forms.RemoteBrowserFileStreamOptions.MaxSegmentSize
member.summary:
Gets or sets the maximum segment size for file data sent over a SignalR circuit. The default value is 20K.
This only has an effect when using Blazor Server.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Forms.RemoteBrowserFileStreamOptions.MaxBufferSize
member.summary:
Gets or sets the maximum internal buffer size for unread data sent over a SignalR circuit.
This only has an effect when using Blazor Server.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Forms.RemoteBrowserFileStreamOptions.SegmentFetchTimeout
member.summary:
Gets or sets the time limit for fetching a segment of file data.
This only has an effect when using Blazor Server.

member.summary: Provides all of the types of operations that are possible. Must be one of none, copy, copyLink, copyMove, link, linkMove, move, all or uninitialized.

member.summary: Supplies information about a keyboard event that is being raised.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Web.KeyboardEventArgs.Key
member.summary: The key value of the key represented by the event. If the value has a printed representation, this attribute's value is the same as the char attribute. Otherwise, it's one of the key value strings specified in 'Key values'. If the key can't be identified, this is the string "Unidentified"

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Web.KeyboardEventArgs.Code
member.summary: Holds a string that identifies the physical key being pressed. The value is not affected by the current keyboard layout or modifier state, so a particular key will always return the same value.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Web.KeyboardEventArgs.Location
member.summary: The location of the key on the device.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Web.KeyboardEventArgs.Repeat
member.summary: true if a key has been depressed long enough to trigger key repetition, otherwise false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Web.KeyboardEventArgs.CtrlKey
member.summary: true if the control key was down when the event was fired. false otherwise.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Web.KeyboardEventArgs.ShiftKey
member.summary: true if the shift key was down when the event was fired. false otherwise.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Web.KeyboardEventArgs.AltKey
member.summary: true if the alt key was down when the event was fired. false otherwise.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Web.KeyboardEventArgs.MetaKey
member.summary: true if the meta key was down when the event was fired. false otherwise.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Web.KeyboardEventArgs.Type
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of the event.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Web.MouseEventArgs
member.summary: Supplies information about a mouse event that is being raised.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Web.MouseEventArgs.Detail
member.summary: A count of consecutive clicks that happened in a short amount of time, incremented by one.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Web.MouseEventArgs.ScreenX
member.summary: The X coordinate of the mouse pointer in global (screen) coordinates.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Web.MouseEventArgs.ScreenY
member.summary: The Y coordinate of the mouse pointer in global (screen) coordinates.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Web.MouseEventArgs.ClientX
member.summary: The X coordinate of the mouse pointer in local (DOM content) coordinates.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Web.MouseEventArgs.ClientY
member.summary: The Y coordinate of the mouse pointer in local (DOM content) coordinates.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Web.MouseEventArgs.OffsetX
member.summary: The X coordinate of the mouse pointer in relative (Target Element) coordinates.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Web.MouseEventArgs.OffsetY
member.summary: The Y coordinate of the mouse pointer in relative (Target Element) coordinates.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Web.MouseEventArgs.Button
member.summary: The button number that was pressed when the mouse event was fired: Left button=0, middle button=1 (if present), right button=2. For mice configured for left handed use in which the button actions are reversed the values are instead read from right to left.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Web.MouseEventArgs.Buttons
member.summary: The buttons being pressed when the mouse event was fired: Left button=1, Right button=2, Middle (wheel) button=4, 4th button (typically, "Browser Back" button)=8, 5th button (typically, "Browser Forward" button)=16. If two or more buttons are pressed, returns the logical sum of the values. E.g., if Left button and Right button are pressed, returns 3 (=1 | 2).

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Web.MouseEventArgs.CtrlKey
member.summary: true if the control key was down when the event was fired. false otherwise.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Web.MouseEventArgs.ShiftKey
member.summary: true if the shift key was down when the event was fired. false otherwise.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Web.MouseEventArgs.AltKey
member.summary: true if the alt key was down when the event was fired. false otherwise.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Web.MouseEventArgs.MetaKey
member.summary: true if the meta key was down when the event was fired. false otherwise.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Web.MouseEventArgs.Type
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of the event.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Web.PointerEventArgs
member.summary: Supplies information about a pointer event that is being raised.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Web.PointerEventArgs.PointerId
member.summary: A unique identifier for the pointer causing the event.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Web.PointerEventArgs.Width
member.summary: The width (magnitude on the X axis), in CSS pixels, of the contact geometry of the pointer.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Web.PointerEventArgs.Height
member.summary: The height (magnitude on the Y axis), in CSS pixels, of the contact geometry of the pointer.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Web.PointerEventArgs.Pressure
member.summary: The normalized pressure of the pointer input in the range of 0 to 1, where 0 and 1 represent the minimum and maximum pressure the hardware is capable of detecting, respectively.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Web.PointerEventArgs.TiltX
member.summary: The plane angle (in degrees, in the range of -90 to 90) between the Y-Z plane and the plane containing both the transducer (e.g. pen stylus) axis and the Y axis.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Web.PointerEventArgs.TiltY
member.summary: The plane angle (in degrees, in the range of -90 to 90) between the X-Z plane and the plane containing both the transducer (e.g. pen stylus) axis and the X axis.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Web.PointerEventArgs.PointerType
member.summary: Indicates the device type that caused the event. Must be one of the strings mouse, pen or touch, or an empty string.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Web.PointerEventArgs.IsPrimary
member.summary: Indicates if the pointer represents the primary pointer of this pointer type.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Web.ProgressEventArgs
member.summary: Supplies information about a progress event that is being raised.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Web.ProgressEventArgs.LengthComputable
member.summary: Whether or not the total size of the transfer is known.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Web.ProgressEventArgs.Loaded
member.summary: The number of bytes transferred since the beginning of the operation. This doesn't include headers and other overhead, but only the content itself.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Web.ProgressEventArgs.Total
member.summary: The total number of bytes of content that will be transferred during the operation. If the total size is unknown, this value is zero.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Web.ProgressEventArgs.Type
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of the event.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Web.TouchEventArgs
member.summary: Supplies information about a touch event that is being raised.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Web.TouchEventArgs.Detail
member.summary: A count of consecutive clicks that happened in a short amount of time, incremented by one.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Web.TouchEventArgs.Touches
member.summary: A list of for every point of contact currently touching the surface.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Web.TouchEventArgs.TargetTouches
member.summary: A list of for every point of contact that is touching the surface and started on the element that is the target of the current event.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Web.TouchEventArgs.ChangedTouches
member.summary: A list of Touches for every point of contact which contributed to the event. For the touchstart event this must be a list of the touch points that just became active with the current event. For the touchmove event this must be a list of the touch points that have moved since the last event. For the touchend and touchcancel events this must be a list of the touch points that have just been removed from the surface.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Web.TouchEventArgs.CtrlKey
member.summary: true if the control key was down when the event was fired. false otherwise.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Web.TouchEventArgs.ShiftKey
member.summary: true if the shift key was down when the event was fired. false otherwise.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Web.TouchEventArgs.AltKey
member.summary: true if the alt key was down when the event was fired. false otherwise.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Web.TouchEventArgs.MetaKey
member.summary: true if the meta key was down when the event was fired. false otherwise.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Web.TouchEventArgs.Type
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of the event.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Web.TouchPoint
member.summary: Represents a single contact point on a touch-sensitive device. The contact point is commonly a finger or stylus and the device may be a touchscreen or trackpad.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Web.TouchPoint.Identifier
member.summary: A unique identifier for this Touch object. A given touch point (say, by a finger) will have the same identifier for the duration of its movement around the surface. This lets you ensure that you're tracking the same touch all the time.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Web.TouchPoint.ScreenX
member.summary: The X coordinate of the touch point relative to the left edge of the screen.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Web.TouchPoint.ScreenY
member.summary: The Y coordinate of the touch point relative to the top edge of the screen.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Web.TouchPoint.ClientX
member.summary: The X coordinate of the touch point relative to the left edge of the browser viewport, not including any scroll offset.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Web.TouchPoint.ClientY
member.summary: The Y coordinate of the touch point relative to the top edge of the browser viewport, not including any scroll offset.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Web.TouchPoint.PageX
member.summary: The X coordinate of the touch point relative to the left edge of the document. Unlike , this value includes the horizontal scroll offset, if any.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Web.TouchPoint.PageY
member.summary: The Y coordinate of the touch point relative to the top of the document. Unlike , this value includes the vertical scroll offset, if any.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Web.WebRenderTreeBuilderExtensions.AddEventPreventDefaultAttribute(Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Rendering.RenderTreeBuilder,System.Int32,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Appends a frame representing an instruction to prevent the default action for a specified event.
member.param: An integer that represents the position of the instruction in the source code.
The name of the event to be affected.
True if the default action is to be prevented, otherwise false.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Web.WebRenderTreeBuilderExtensions.AddEventStopPropagationAttribute(Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Rendering.RenderTreeBuilder,System.Int32,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Appends a frame representing an instruction to stop the specified event from propagating beyond the current element.
member.param: An integer that represents the position of the instruction in the source code.
The name of the event to be affected.
True if propagation should be stopped here, otherwise false.
